Dear Melynda Williams:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
1

background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On an unknown day, a youth was screaming at a youth at the
facility who was trying to open a door to a room. Another group of
youth were getting up and the staff member used inappropriate
language while speaking to the youth.
Investigation Interviews:
On 03/04/2025 a voicemail message was left for Foster Care
Worker (FCW) requesting a return call with any concerns
associated with placement of Youth A at Zonta.
On 03/04/2025 a voicemail message was left for Complainant
requesting a return call with any additional concerns relative to
Youth A and placement at Zonta.
The following interviews were completed at Whaley Center on
3/05/2025 unless otherwise noted.
An interview was completed with Program Manager. She
provided employment information regarding Staff 1 and confirmed
that the alleged incident happened on March 1, 2025. She
provided information of the additional staff and youth that were
present the day of the incident. Program Manager advised that
this is not the first allegation of Staff 1 making inappropriate verbal
statements with youth and other staff. Staff 1 is currently on
administrative leave.
An interview was completed with Compliance Supervisor. A
request was made for the incident report and human resource
information for Staff 1. Compliance Supervisor denied that she
has any direct knowledge of Staff 1 using any inappropriate
language in the presence of youth prior to the allegation.
An interview was completed with Youth B. She reported on
March 1st she was taking a shower and Staff 1 told her to hurry up
because another youth needed to shower. Youth B reported she
did take a while but got out of the shower and was using the mirror
to get dressed when Staff 1 called her annoying. Youth B denied
hearing Staff 1 make a statement about youth waiting. However,
she did report that she heard Staff 1 say something like “let me
clock out before I slap this bitch.” Youth B stated that youth are
afraid of Staff 1.
2

An interview was held with Youth A. She denied that on this day
Staff 1 said anything to her. But confirmed that she heard Staff 1
say something like “I will smack your ass really hard, and this
Bitch is pissing me off.” Youth A stated Staff 1 made these
statements before she clocked out.
An interview was held with Youth D. She reported she heard
Staff 1 tell Youth B that she would smack her and then Staff 1 said
let me leave before I smack this kid.
An interview was held with Supervisor 1. She reported that Staff
1 called her on March 1st around 2pm and told her that she said “I
could slap the fuck outta that Bitch” and stated she was
referencing Youth B. Supervisor 1 reported she advised Staff 1 to
leave the building.
An interview was held with Staff 3. She denied that she uses
profanity when speaking with the youth and denied hearing other
staff use profanity. Staff 3 stated the youth don’t like that she
does her job and holds them accountable.
On 03/25/2025 an interview was completed with Staff 4 at Zonta.
She denied using profanity or making any threats toward the youth
and denied hearing other staff engage in that behavior.
The following interviews were completed via telephone on
03/28/2025 unless otherwise noted.
An interview was completed with Staff 1. She reported that she is
currently off work on administrative leave. She reported having a
good relationship with the youth. Staff 1 advised that she made
the statement “let me clock out before I slap this girl”. She denied
that she had any intention to slap the youth. She denied hearing
other staff use profanity toward the youth. Staff 1 stated the youth
don’t like the structure she attempted to provide.
An interview was completed with Staff 2. She reported that Staff
1 did make the statement about slapping Youth 1. She denied
that she uses profanity toward the youth.
Documents Reviewed:
Whaley Progressive Discipline Form for Staff 1. On 12/14/24 Staff
1 received a written waring for failing to follow agency policy
relative to driving the agency vehicle as she was tracked going 89
3

MPH in a 70 MPH zone. On 04/08/2024 Staff 1 received
disciplinary points for documenting in an incident report that she
did not allow a youth to shower after spraying “fart spray” on
herself and the staff.
Whaley Children’s Center Disruptive Behavior Report – Dated
March 2, 2025 and was written by Staff 1. The incident report
indicated that Youth A was escalated regarding her shower time
and Staff 1 made attempts to redirect her without success. There
is no documentation in the incident report relative to Staff 1
making a threat to Youth A.
Whaley Physical Intervention Policy – indicates any type of
physical punishment including but not limited to: iv. Verbal abuse
including the use of derogatory or discriminatory language
including negative references to a youth’s background or
appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats, ridicule, or
humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Tour of Agency:
On 3/25/2025 a tour of Zonta was completed. The facility was
found to be well maintained, and no areas of concern were noted.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to not
be in compliance with licensing rule 4158-1-a-iv. Both staff and
youth were interviewed and reported that Staff 1 made a
threatening statement to Youth B. In addition, Staff 1 confirmed
that she made the statement, although she denied any intention of
acting on statement.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A CAP is required.
